definition: Puccini
general/popular/everywhere/universal
to carve/carved words/to agree/a contract/a deed
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)

sentences.english: He was praised to the skies by Puccini and Schoenberg.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被普契尼和勳伯格捧上了天。

sentences.english: Puccini meets a young journalist who questions him and directs him towards the original sources of his vocation.
sentences.chinese: 一位年輕的記者當面質問了普契尼的創作靈感的來源。

sentences.english: Summary: Verdi and Puccini are both the most prominent Italian opera composer.
sentences.chinese: 威爾第和普契尼都是意大利最卓越的歌劇作曲家。

sentences.english: I am watching the great opera of Puccini, Turandot.
sentences.chinese: 我正在觀看普契尼的歌劇鉅作《圖蘭多》。

sentences.english: The second chapter concerns with Puccini and his opera 'Turandot'.
sentences.chinese: 第二章是普契尼及其歌劇《圖蘭朵》。

Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
